member.name: T:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportRootDesigner
member.summary: ReportRootDesigner is the user interface we present to users when they create a new report. Individual elements can be visually designed on this container. We also add a toolbox item filter to the class definition that requires any toolbox items to have the filter name of "MindFusion.Reporting.Design". We also define this filter name in the ReportItem base class. This disables all toolbox items that are not derived from ReportItem.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportRootDesigner.OnSelectionChanged(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Event handler for the selection changed event. We draw the selection's grab handles in our paint logic for the control, so when the selection changes we need to tell the control to update. We try to be optimial here and we only update the areas of the control that have changed.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportRootDesigner.OnLoadComplete(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Event handler for the load complete event. We listen to this event so that after the element designer is loaded we can add a toolbox item to the toolbox. We must wait until after the load completes because the fully qualified name of the base class is not known until that time.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportRootDesigner.InvalidateBounds(System.Object)
member.summary: This is a helper method that invalidates our control using the bounding rectangle of the given element. The parameter is typed as object for convenience; this method actually looks for a BoundingBox property on the object that has a property type of RectangleF, so anything that satisifies this will work.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportRootDesigner.OnComponentChanging(System.Object,System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangingEventArgs)
member.summary: Event handler for the ComponentChanging event. Here we invalidate the control so it repaints at the region where the given component is located. When an element is moved or sized, there will be a ComponentChanging event before the element moves, and then a ComponentChanged event. We need to invalidate the control at both positions.

member.summary: Command handler for the Paste command.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportRootDesigner.OnMenuPasteStatus(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This is a speical callback command that is used to update the status of the Paste command. Normally changing the status of a command is done by us in response to some sort of change. For example, Cut, Copy and Delete are all enabled whenever there is a non-zero selection and the base Report object isn't selected. Paste is special, however, because enabling it is based solely on the contents of the clipboard. We have defined another class below called ImmediateMenuCommand. This class derives from MenuCommand and has an additional event handler that is called whenever Visual Studio wants to know the status of a command. Here we check the data type on the clipboard to see if it supports our format.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportRootDesigner.SetItemDocumentBounds(MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportItemDesigner,System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Sets the specified rectangle, expressed in document coordinates, as a bounding rectangle of the specified item. If the item is located in a container, the item position is adjusted relative to its container so that it document position is equal to the specified rectangle.
member.remarks: The bounds are set through the item's designer BoundingBox property so we expect this operation to be undoable.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportRootDesigner.System#Drawing#Design#IToolboxUser#GetToolSupported(System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem)
member.summary: IToolboxUser.GetToolSupported explicit implementation.
member.remarks: This method is actually never called. In order for this method to be called, we must have specified a ToolboxItemFilterType of Custom. Our filtering needs are very simple so we don't need to do that. Custom filter types should be used with caution because they can impact the performance of your designer.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportRootDesigner.System#Drawing#Design#IToolboxUser#ToolPicked(System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem)
member.summary: IToolboxUser.ToolPicked explicit implementation.
member.remarks: This is called by the toolbox service when the user double clicks on a toolbox item. The item we get has already passed the filter test so we don't need to do any additional checks. Toolbox items know how to create their own components, so creating a new element here is really easy.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportItemDesigner
member.summary: Provides a base class for the designers of all report elements.
member.remarks:
Each report element has its own designer. This is a base class that all individaul report item designers derive from. It's mostly abstract and is used to provide a way to manipulate different report elements at design time.
The page and header designers also derive from this class. This way the manipulation of all report elements at design-time becomes more uniform.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportItemDesigner.HitTest(MindFusion.Reporting.Design.HitTestInfo)
member.summary: Performs hit-testing at design-time.
member.remarks: The root designer will call this for every mouse move to determine if the mouse is hovering over a report element. The supplied argument will be populated with the data necessary to identify the hit element if any.
member.param: Supplies information for the hit-testing operation. Upon completion contains information identifying the hit-tested element.
member.returns: true if something has been hit; otherwise, false.

member.returns: true whether the interaction has been performed successfully; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Returns the cursor for the specified glyph on the current element.
member.param: An object that has been previously hit-tested with the HitTest method and assigned to the HitGlyph property of the HitTestInfo parameter.
member.returns: The cursor that should be displayed for the specified glyph.

member.summary: Called at the end of a successful drag to perform the actual move of the report element.
member.param: The glyph object hit-tested by a prior call to the HitTest method.
The amount to space the report element has been dragged along the x-axis.
The amount to space the report element has been dragged along the y-axis.
The absolute x-position of the mouse cursor, in document coordinates.
The absolute y-position of the mouse cursor, in document coordinates.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportItemDesigner.DrawAdornments(System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Used to draw the correct adnornments for this object.
member.remarks: This will be called only if the object is currently selected.
member.param: The graphics object to draw the adornments to. The coordinate system will be preset to match the coordinates of the report element.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportItemDesigner.DrawDragFeedback(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Object,System.Drawing.PointF,System.Drawing.PointF)
member.summary: Used to draw feedback to the user.
member.param: The target graphics where the feedback should be rendered.
The glyph object hit-tested by a prior call to the HitTest method.
The current offset of the mouse from where the drag began. This starts at (0, 0) when the user initiates a drag and then changes depending on how far the mouse has moved from its starting position.
The absolute mouse position, in document coordinates.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportItemDesigner.DrawDesign(System.Drawing.Graphics,MindFusion.Reporting.DrawContext)
member.summary: Renders the underlying item in design view.
member.remarks: The base implementation of this method simply invokes the item's Draw method with the current item location. More specific designers draw a frame or a background to items that are otherwise difficult to see or interact with.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportItemDesigner.DrawOrderingNumber(System.Drawing.Graphics)

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.ReportItemDesigner.PreFilterProperties(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties override.
member.remarks: The set of PreFilter and PostFilter methods are used to modify the metadata that a component presents. The PreFilter methods are used when you want to add or remove specific pieces of metadata. The PostFilter methods are used when you want to make changes to all pieces of metadata. For example, we are adding a new property here, so we use PreFilterProperites. If we wanted to something global to properties, like change all properties on a component to read-only, we would do this in PostFilterProperties. The only rule to follow here is that in PreFilter, always call base.PreFilter before your own code, and in PostFilter, always call base.PostFilter last.
member.param: A dictionary of properties to filter. The keys of the dictionary are property names and the values are PropertyDescriptors. This dictionary can be modified in this method.

member.summary: ReportItemDesigner.GetCursor override.
member.remarks: We return one of five cursors, depending on the value of the hitObject passed in. If the object is HitMove, we return the size all cursor which is a four headed arrow (indicating a move of the element). For other hit tests we return a cursor that matches the direction of the movement.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Reporting.Label.EvaluationContext.ReportParameterWrapper
member.summary: Represents a wrapper of ReportParameter objects. The wrapper properties delegate to the wrapped parameter's properties with the exception of Value when the parameter represents an expression. In this case the expression is evaluated and the result is returned.
member.remarks: The purpose of this class is to handle expressions which reference a property value directly, for example, [Parameters.MyParam.Value]. In this case Value will be resolved automatically through reflection by the scripting engine and if it is expression it will not be evaluated.

member.summary: A map of all brushes.
member.remarks: During serialization, this map will contain all serialized brushes, mapped to their indices. During deserialization, the brushes are loaded from the appropriate section in the Xml file, the first time they are accessed. This list is of type (Brush, int) when serializing and of type (int, Brush) when deserializing.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Reporting.XmlSerializationContext.images
member.summary: A map of all images.
member.remarks: During serialization, this map will contain all serialized images, mapped to their indices. During deserialization, the images are loaded from the appropriate section in the Xml file, the first time they are accessed. This list is of type (Image, int) when serializing and of type (int, Image) when deserializing.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Reporting.XmlSerializationContext.formatter
member.summary: A binary formatter used when serializing arbitrary objects.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Reporting.XmlSerializationContext.DeserializeDataSource

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.DesignerView.SelectPrevious(System.ComponentModel.IComponent)
member.summary: Selects the component preceding to the specified component.
member.remarks: Attempts to select the previous sibling of the specified component. If there is no previous sibling, attempts to select the last child of the previous sibling of the component's parent.
member.returns: true, if the preceding component has been selected; false, if the selection remained unchanged.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.DesignerView.SelectNext(System.ComponentModel.IComponent)
member.summary: Selects the component next to the specified component.
member.remarks: If the component is a container, select its first child. Otherwise, attempts to select its next sibling. Otherwise, attempts to select the next sibling of its parent etc.
member.returns: true, if the next component has been selected; false, if the selection remained unchanged.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.CanvasDesigner.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a data source indirectly associated with this canvas through its parent.
member.remarks: This is a 'ghost' property whose sole purpose is to fool the DataMemberListEditor of the canvas's DataField property. The value of this property is null, unless the canvas is contained within a container object, which exposes a DataSource property. In this case the value of this property is the same as the value of the DataSource property of the parent container.

member.summary: A pen used to draw a frame around pictures in design time.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.PictureDesigner.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a data source indirectly associated with this picture through its parent.
member.remarks: This is a 'ghost' property whose sole purpose is to fool the DataMemberListEditor of the picture's DataField property. The value of this property is null, unless the picture is contained within a container object, which exposes a DataSource property. In this case the value of this property is the same as the value of the DataSource property of the parent container.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Reporting.Design.LineDesigner.GetCursor(System.Object)
member.summary: ReportItemDesigner.GetCursor override.
member.remarks: We return one of three cursors, depending on the value of the hitGlyph object passed in. If the glyph is HitMove, we return the size all cursor which is a four headed arrow (indicating a move of the element). If the glyph object is either HitStart or HitEnd we calculate the slope of the line, either positive or negative, so we can return a move cursor that looks right with respect to the line.

member.summary: ReportItemDesigner.Drag override.
member.remarks: Here we either move one or both points of the line depending on what hit object was passed.
